title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with grated cheeses and plenty of black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Working quickly, toss hot pasta with pancetta, then remove from heat and stir in egg mixture.
Add reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a large pan, melt butter and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cream and add cooked chicken.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Classic Pancakes
summary: Fluffy, golden breakfast pancakes that are perfect for a weekend morning.
instructions: In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in milk, egg, and melted butter.
Mix until smooth - don't overmix, lumps are okay.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop batter onto the griddle, using about 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with butter, maple syrup, and fresh berries.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Crisp romaine lettuce, crunchy croutons, and shaved parmesan cheese with creamy Caesar dressing.
ingredients: 2 heads romaine lettuce, torn into pieces
instructions: For the dressing, mash anchovies and garlic into a paste.
Whisk in egg yolk, lemon juice, and mustard.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking constantly until emulsified.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss lettuce with dressing until coated.
Top with croutons and shaved Parmesan.
Serve immediately.
